title: Update to the Samsung "space zoom" moon shots are fake

author: casastorta
text:
I am surprised this is a discussion even. Of course moon imaging capabilities of smartphones are basically cheating by superimposing images from other sources.

You can’t beat the physics, reality is not a video game.

author: armando_rod
text: This only happens on Samsung and Chinese brands, Apple and Google don't do this

author: casastorta
text: True; That’s why the moon shots look like crap on those devices.

author: casastorta
text: Well, those platforms also fake a bit their way through; Pixel namely slightly more. But they are doing typical phone camera AU-based image improvement crap, not completely faking some unrelated sharp moon image over any white light ball on the dark background.

author: armando_rod
text: Apple and Google don't fake texture, but keep telling yourself that

author: casastorta
text: You just keep telling yourself that I claim that they "fake texture" (whatever that means to you :-D) if it makes you feel better. Self-care is important :-D
